action.content:
You are a language wizard who likes to guess words by using the given rules.

Welcome to Wordle! You have six attempts to guess the target word, a valid English word of five lowercase letters (a-z). Please use the tags "explanation:" and "guess:" to provide a concise explanation for each guess.

For instance, if your guess is "apple", your response should be
explanation: this is a common five-letter English word, and I am starting my guess with this word.
guess: apple

After each guess, your answer will be validated, and you will receive feedback indicating which letters are correct (green), which letters are correct but in the wrong position (yellow), and which letters are incorrect (red). This feedback can be useful in determining which letters to include or exclude in your next guess.

For example, the feedback for "apple" might be:
guess_feedback: a<yellow> p<yellow> p<green> l<yellow> e<red>

The explanation should contain details about how the guess_feedback is used to arrive at a new guess.

Do not generate any other text.

Let's begin with your first guess.

explanation: I am starting with a commonly used five-letter word in English. 
guess: house

attempts = 1
target_word = gland
guess = house
guess_feedback = h<red> o<red> u<red> s<red> e<red>

guess_feedback: h<red> o<red> u<red> s<red> e<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: Since all letters in "house" are marked as red, my next guess will be a completely different set of letters, trying to cover more possibilities in the alphabet.
guess: brink

attempts = 2
target_word = gland
guess = brink
guess_feedback = b<red> r<red> i<red> n<green> k<red>

guess_feedback: b<red> r<red> i<red> n<green> k<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The letter "n" is marked as green, so I will keep it in my next guess. I will try to combine "n" with other commonly used letters in English words, avoiding the letters "b", "r", "i", "k", "h", "o", "u", "s", and "e" that were previously marked as red.
guess: clang

attempts = 3
target_word = gland
guess = clang
guess_feedback = c<red> l<green> a<green> n<green> g<yellow>

guess_feedback: c<red> l<green> a<green> n<green> g<yellow>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The letters "l", "a", and "n" are marked as green, so I will keep them in my next guess. The letter "g" is marked as yellow, indicating it is in the word but not in the correct position. I will try to rearrange these letters and replace "c" with a new letter, aiming to utilize the correct letters and their positions.
guess: angel

attempts = 4
target_word = gland
guess = angel
guess_feedback = a<yellow> n<yellow> g<yellow> e<red> l<yellow>

guess_feedback: a<yellow> n<yellow> g<yellow> e<red> l<yellow>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The letters "a", "n", "g", and "l" are all marked as yellow, indicating they are in the word but not in the correct positions. I will try to rearrange these letters again, focusing on finding the correct order. Since "e" is marked as red, I will replace it with a new letter.
guess: gland

attempts = 5
target_word = gland
guess = gland
guess_feedback = g<green> l<green> a<green> n<green> d<green>

guess_explanation: I am starting with a commonly used five-letter word in English.
Since all letters in "house" are marked as red, my next guess will be a completely different set of letters, trying to cover more possibilities in the alphabet.

The letter "n" is marked as green, so I will keep it in my next guess. I will try to combine "n" with other commonly used letters in English words, avoiding the letters "b", "r", "i", "k", "h", "o", "u", "s", and "e" that were previously marked as red.

The letters "l", "a", and "n" are marked as green, so I will keep them in my next guess. The letter "g" is marked as yellow, indicating it is in the word but not in the correct position. I will try to rearrange these letters and replace "c" with a new letter, aiming to utilize the correct letters and their positions.

The letters "a", "n", "g", and "l" are all marked as yellow, indicating they are in the word but not in the correct positions. I will try to rearrange these letters again, focusing on finding the correct order. Since "e" is marked as red, I will replace it with a new letter.
